function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Transient response of infection growth rates following policy deployment","Impact":"Incomplete understanding of the impact of policies on infection growth rates","Mitigation":"Conducting robustness checks and exploring alternative models","Technologies":"Statistical modeling and data analysis tools","People":"Population in the cities being observed","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Imposing assumptions regarding the temporal structure of policy effects","Impact":"Biased estimation of policy effects and inadequate policy recommendations","Mitigation":"Using a distributed-lag model to estimate policy effects without imposing assumptions","Technologies":"Statistical modeling and data analysis tools","People":"Policy analysts, researchers","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies"},{"Description":"Limited data availability and shorter periods of observation in other countries","Impact":"Inability to explore the dynamics of policy effects on infection growth rates in other countries","Mitigation":"Encouraging future studies to collect more comprehensive data and explore alternative methods of analysis","Technologies":"Data collection and statistical modeling tools","People":"Researchers, data analysts","Owner":"Research institutions, international health organizations"}]}
